result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael G. Whatley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The costs are to be paid at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning June 1, 2016.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

Defendant Michael G. Whatley in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record. Victim rights complied with.   Defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waives right to an attorney.  Plea of guilty to count 2 - OAR.  Plea colloquy.   Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2 - OAR.  Court dismisses and read in count 1.  Court dismisses and read in Case No. 15CM134 and 15TR929. No statements regarding sentence.  Court orders court costs; DNA sample and surcharge.  The costs are to be paid at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning June 1, 2016   Appeal rights given to defendant.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael G. Whatley
Current: 3023 HWY CR, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 12-29-2015)
Prior: 729A South 26th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220

Defendant Michael G. Whatley in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waive reading of complaint and charges.  Court explains the penalties to defendant.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Court enters plea of not guilty on defendant's behalf.  Bond continued.  Defendant gives court his new address as 3023 HWY CR, Manitowoc, Wisconsin 54220.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  - rt  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Initial Appearance on December 29, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael G. Whatley appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty request a $1,000.00 signature bond; booking and no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  So ordered by the court.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Next court date is December 29, 2015 at 1:00 pm. - rt
